question.text: All of the following statements are correct for blue green algae, except

options.text: they have chlorophyll - a, which is also found in higher plants.
they may be filamentous, colonial, or unicellular.
they have heterocysts which are clear cells without chlorophyll.
they are connecting link between plants and animals.

solution.text: Cyanobacteria have autotrophic nutrition and can perform photosynthesis with the help of chlorophyll-a which is similar in green plants. They may be unicellular, colonial, or filamentous forms. Nitrogen fixation in cyanobacteria mainly occurs in specialized cells called heterocysts. Heterocysts are large-sized, pale-colored, non-motile, mucilage free thick-walled cells that are impermeable to oxygen. Euglena is the connecting link between plants and animals.
